item.title: Baldur's Gate 3 Mod Adds Real-Time Combat
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • A new mod introduces real-time combat to Baldur's Gate 3, speeding up fights and overhauling the gameplay.
  • The mod may not appeal to all players due to altering the beloved turn-based combat of the game, as well as its current lack of key features.
  • Baldur's Gate 3 offers a variety of impressive mods beyond real-time combat, catering to different player preferences.

A new Baldur’s Gate 3 mod has recently introduced real-time combat to the game, completely overhauling the previous turn-based combat system. While the combat of Baldur’s Gate 3 is often praised due to the high degree of freedom it gives players, some gamers dislike turn-based combat and how long it can be, so this mod could be a perfect addition for them.

Released in 2023 after being in early access for almost three years, Baldur’s Gate 3 is Larian Studios’ biggest hit to date. Not only did BG3 sell over 10 million copies, but it also won many awards across different competitions, including Game of the Year at The Game Awards. Due to the game’s huge popularity, Baldur’s Gate 3 also has a thriving modding scene with some very impressive projects.

Now, a modder called tinybike has unveiled a new real-time combat mod for Baldur’s Gate 3 . Described as a “very rough draft” by its creator, the mod essentially allows the player to control their BG3 character in real-time, making fights much, much faster, but harder to control. Tinybike also unveiled a short video showcasing the combat, in which they can be seen fighting bandits in a ruin near the game’s beginning. At the moment, however, the mod does not have some important features, such as the ability to pause during fights or an AI for companions. So, gamers who don’t want to play their character solo may want to wait a few weeks before downloading the mod.

New Real-Time Combat Mod Completely Overhauls Baldur's Gate 3's Fights

Obviously, this will likely be a controversial mod. Baldur’s Gate 3 is considered one of the best RPGs of 2023, and part of the reason for that is because gamers adore its intricate and creative turn-based combat, so the change will likely not appeal to all audiences equally. For anyone wanting to start a fresh playthrough, however, tinybike’s real-time combat mod may sound like an excellent idea.

This is just one of many excellent Baldur’s Gate 3 mods, though. After the introduction of official mod support in Baldur’s Gate 3 ’s Patch 7, more and more incredible mods are popping up, offering multiple new features for players.

Among the best Baldur’s Gate 3 mods released so far, players can pick options that will allow them to highlight items in the wild, gain access to new races or subclasses during character creation, use WASD character movement, unlock AI party control during combat, and much more. So, even gamers not using the new real-time combat mod still have plenty of modding options in Baldur’s Gate 3 .

item.title: A Lack of The Sims 5 Could Be a Blessing in Disguise for The Sims 4 Players
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • The Sims 5 isn't in the works, according to EA.
  • EA's profitable DLC model will keep The Sims 4 afloat for the foreseeable future.
  • Project Rene offers a new multiplayer experience, with no release date confirmed yet.

Kate Gorman, who is EA’s vice president and general manager of The Sims franchise, recently had an interview with Variety, and a lot was revealed about the future of The Sims . Surprisingly, she claims that there are no plans for The Sims 5 , and the studio is going to continue supplying The Sims 4 with paid expansions and DLCs. Though The Sims 5 is not in development, Maxis is busy with Project Rene, a mysterious game that will feature multiplayer.

According to Gorman, this decision was made to prevent players from having to start all over again after investing so much in The Sims 4 . Gorman also let fans know that they'll receive more information on Project Rene soon. Though some players may wish for The Sims 5 , there are a few reasons to believe that EA has made the right choice.

EA Has Found a Sales Model for The Sims That Works

When The Sims 4 launched in 2013, the base game was a paid project, and Maxis would regularly supply the game with DLC. It soon became apparent how lucrative DLC was, and in 2022, the game went free-to-play, though the DLC still comes with a price tag. There have been dozens of DLCs released, including the recently launched Lovestruck DLC which has been available since July.

This new model has kept the 2013 game alive and profitable. So long as there is a steady stream of new DLC, EA can always make more money from The Sims 4 's massive install base. The good news is that EA plans on supporting The Sims 4 for a long time, and it will still be "continuing to support TS4 more than ever. Still continue to deliver expansion packs and updates and fixes."

The Sims 4 Players Get to Keep Their Years of Progress

This is good news for players who have invested heavily in The Sims 4 . All the expansions purchased won't go to waste, as The Sims 4 will continue to be supported for a long time, saving players the cost of building up a DLC collection from scratch with The Sims 5 . It also allows players to save all their gameplay and generations of families that they've bonded with.

As part of Maxis' continued support of The Sims 4 , Gorman revealed that The Sims will begin selling “Creator Kits” based on user-generated content made by players. Modding is a huge part of The Sims for a lot of players, and this serves as confirmation that "those creators will be compensated for their work being sold as digital products by EA."

Project Rene's Coming For Players Who Want Something New

The announcement will have some players happy, but others may be disappointed that a new numbered The Sims game isn't coming anytime soon. Gorman discussed Project Rene, a new game that is in development. It will be available on PC and mobile, and it will feature a multiplayer mode. According to Gorman, developers have learned a lot with The Sims Online and are looking to create an experience that features a world with real players and NPCs.

For players looking for something new from The Sims franchise, Project Rene is the game to look out for. It is still in the early stages of development, and a release window hasn't been revealed yet, so it's best not to expect it to launch anytime soon.

The Sims franchise has a busy future ahead, even though it won't feature The Sims 5 . In addition to Project Rene, The Sims movie is in the works, and it is being produced at Amazon MGM Studios by Margot Robbie’s LuckyChap. The Sims 4 can also look forward to the Life & Death expansion pack launching in October.

item.title: 2024 Video Game Release Date Calendar
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Games in January 2024
  • Games in February 2024
  • Games in March 2024
  • Games in April 2024
  • Games in May 2024
  • Games in June 2024
  • Games in July 2024
  • Games in August 2024
  • Games in September 2024
  • Games in October 2024
  • Games in November 2024
  • Games in December 2024
  • Big 2024 TBA Games

2024 is another fantastic year for video games. Nintendo released a brand-new game starring Princess Peach; Dragon's Dogma finally got a sequel; the next part of the acclaimed Final Fantasy 7 remake came out; Star Wars is getting another open-world adventure, which just scratches the surface. We should expect many more 2024 video game release dates as more presentations happen, like the next State of Play, Nintendo Direct, and all the other online streams.

Interactive Calendar Here

Updated September 23...

To the Moon comes to PS5 and XSX/S on October 8.

Blasphemous 2 DLC ‘ Mea Culpa ’ comes out on October 31.

Predator: Hunting Grounds comes out on October 1 for PS5 and XSX/S.

So, for the gamers who would like to plan their gaming sessions ahead of time, here's a list of the major video games coming out in 2024 . We'll try to keep this article updated every week or so with any changes, such as delays, cancellations, and new announcements from the big publishers.

We'll list each month below and then have a 2024 TBA list at the bottom. The TBA section will have the 2024 video games that we don't have confirmed dates yet for but are still planned for release in the new year.

item.title: Now Is the Best Time to Start Playing Mass Effect, But Fans Have to Act Fast
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Mass Effect: Legendary Edition is currently 85% off on Steam, making it a steal at $8.99 for three remastered games.
  • The sale ends on September 26, so fans of sci-fi RPGs, like Starfield, should act quickly to add it to their library.
  • The trilogy offers captivating visuals, deep storytelling, and plot-altering choices that carry over from game to game.

BioWare fans and potential newcomers are in for a big treat with Mass Effect: Legendary Edition , as there may not be a better time to purchase and play the game. However, they will need to act fast or risk missing out on the deal of a lifetime, considering Mass Effect: Legendary Edition consists of some of the best sci-fi RPGs ever made.

Mass Effect: Legendary Edition includes every bit of the base content and over 40 DLC from the acclaimed Mass Effect , Mass Effect 2 , and Mass Effect 3 games, along with promo weapons, armor, and packs. This particular edition of the Mass Effect trilogy has also been remastered and optimized for 4K Ultra HD, resulting in more modern visuals. As Mass Effect: Legendary Edition is currently on sale on Steam for a limited time, anyone who has yet to play it or would simply like to play through it again should act fast.

Mass Effect: Legendary Edition Is Worth Playing While It's on Sale

Mass Effect: Legendary Edition Is Temporarily 85% Off on Steam and More Than Worth It

The primary reason Mass Effect: Legendary Edition is worth playing right now is that it's temporarily on sale on Steam for 85% off its normal price of $59.99, making it $8.99 currently. Considering the Mass Effect trilogy is already an experience worth having, and Mass Effect: Legendary Edition only enhances that experience by several miles, $8.99 is a steal for what it offers. Three games in one package with captivating visuals, satisfying gameplay, and a story that still holds up today for less than $10 is absurdly cheap.

The Mass Effect: Legendary Edition Steam sale will only last from now until September 26, leaving players with a limited amount of time to add it to their Steam library. Anyone who can't decide whether $9 is worth spending on Mass Effect: Legendary Edition should know that it's one of the greatest sci-fi RPG trilogies ever made, an eternal reminder of BioWare's golden age, and a timeless testament to the developer's influence on the gaming industry — especially when it comes to RPGs.

Mass Effect: Legendary Edition Is Perfect for Fans of Starfield and Other Sci-Fi RPGs

While Mass Effect: Legendary Edition 's limited-time sale may be due to the impending arrival of BioWare's highly anticipated fantasy RPG Dragon Age: The Veilguard , the sale also comes at the right time for any fans of Starfield and its upcoming Shattered Space DLC. Starfield may be played from the first-person perspective and Mass Effect: Legendary Edition from the third, but the latter is still a great appetizer for what Shattered Space may offer in terms of gameplay, atmosphere, and storytelling. This rings especially true with Shattered Space aiming to be a more linear experience than what Starfield 's base game offers, just as Mass Effect: Legendary Edition is throughout each of its installments.

Players don't need to be Starfield fans to enjoy Mass Effect: Legendary Edition , however, as it is as good as it gets when it comes to sci-fi RPGs. Mass Effect: Legendary Edition offers players an authentic sci-fi world, with plenty of planets to explore and alien species to encounter. Furthermore, just as they can in almost any BioWare game, players can recruit various companions to go along with them on their journey and even romance some of Mass Effect 's most popular romanceable characters. Finally, players are presented with plenty of plot-altering choices throughout the Mass Effect trilogy, with the effects of those choices even carrying over from one game to the next.

All in all, Steam's current sale for Mass Effect: Legendary Edition is worth it for the massive price drop alone, but fans of Starfield and other sci-fi RPGs arguably shouldn't think twice about adding it to their collection. Again, the sale only lasts until September 26, so fans will need to act fast.

item.title: Free to Play Bethesda Arena Shooter Sees Huge Spike in Players
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Quake Champions experienced a 300% player count increase recently, peaking at nearly 2,000 players over the weekend.
  • The game's rise in popularity appears to be linked to a recent 2v2 tournament with money prize rewards.
  • A dedicated community can rejuvenate multiplayer games like Quake, proving their resilience and ongoing appeal.

Arena shooter Quake Champions has seen a massive spike in player count recently, rising almost 300% above the game's monthly average. The free-to-play shooter based on Quake typically sees an average of 500 concurrent players, but over the weekend that number has risen to nearly 2,000.

Quake Champions is an arena-based hero shooter that combines the classic, fast-paced arcade combat of Quake games with a contemporary twist in the form of "champions," which are various characters to choose from, each with their own abilities and playstyles. The game sat in early access for a long time, before being fully released in August 2022. In that time, that game has not seen much growth despite Quake Champions being free-to-play, but for some reason, the player count for the game recently rocket-jumped from its usual numbers, with a 24-hour peak of 1,943 and a current player count of 1,753 at the time of writing.

As reported by PCGamesN, Quake Champions is currently seeing a surprising peak in player count. While speculation, hype, and rumors fly around regarding the possibility of a new Quake game, some fans are occupying their time with this modern arcade shooter, and it isn't exactly clear why. The latest major update for the game, season 24, was released on September 12. The game has always been free-to-play, so there was no sale to bring players in, and it hasn't peaked on Twitch or been covered by a big YouTuber recently. Despite this, the game rose from 508 players to 1,909 in the space of an hour on September 22, and these numbers persisted throughout the following day.

Quake Champions Sees a Huge Player Spike

Quake is a series that arguably helped kickstart the popularity of the FPS genre, but has since faded into the background as id Software and Bethesda have worked on other titles. While an increase of 1,500 players may not seem like much, it's a relatively large spike for Quake Champions . From deeper investigation as to where these numbers came from, a thread on r/QuakeChampions talks about a 2v2 tournament that was held on September 22, with a money prize as a reward. The tournament was open to all players and coincided with when Quake Champions ' player count spiked. Despite the tournament being over 24 hours ago, the game has managed to retain the increased player count since then, suggesting that the tournament and the surrounding hype potentially brought some old-school fans out of the woodwork.

A game can only be as lively as its community, and this is especially true for multiplayer titles such as Quake Champions . This isn't the first time that a game's passionate community has helped keep it alive or revitalized its popularity, and is a warming reminder that as long as there are dedicated fans, games can never truly die.
